He has finished all of the required research, but wants to keep the results confidential.<n><n>## Learning Task:<n>A learning task is a series of instructions for the user that provides an example on how to solve the problem that the task represents.<n><n>### Learning Task Description<n>When a student is instructed to finish an essay, they sometimes forget that it is a requirement to finish the results, and if they don't want anyone to see the work, they can write the work on the computer in secret, just like we do it at school<n><n>### Steps:<n>1.  Create a new blank document in Word.<n>2.  Make sure that every element of the document is empty with nothing on the document.<n>3.  Make sure the document

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:John and Jane were a couple. Choices:  A: make sex B: plan to marry C: dance D: electrical circuit E: row about<n><n>### Response:		They made sex.<n><n>### Context: <n>For this example, we will be using a set-up for when the user is in the input state. <n><n>#### In the input state, the following properties may be set:<n><n>##### `question` -- String holding the question to be asking the user to answer.<n>##### `type` -- String of what type of question is to be asked the user: <n>`"multiple_choice"` -- for a multiple-choice question.<n>`"answer"` -- for a multiple choice answer.<n><n>When a multipl-choice question is asked, the user will be asked to chose from multiple choice answers for the above property of the question.<n><n>When an answer to a question is held, it follows the following format:<n><n>`<question.questionType> - Question_title - <options (comma separated if there is more than one)> `<n><n>An example would be:<n>`<multiple_choice.question> - What is the question? - 1, 2, 3 `<n><n># Examples<n><n>Instruction: What is the word `Hello` written in Spanish?<n><n>Answer: Hola<n><n>Instruction:What is the word `Hello World` written in Spanish? Hola Mundo<n><n>## Question Type Descriptions<n>These examples will show what each question type looks like. <n>### Multiple Choice Answer.<n>A multiple choice question is exactly what it sounds like.  <n>These questions can be answered with one of several answers. <n>#### Input<n>The input for a multiple choice answer will be of the form `<question.questionType> : Your_Question (title) - <options (compression separated if there are more that one)`.<n>#### Response<n>The input will response with each possible answer and then the question with each answer on a new line. <n>#### Example:<n>Multiple Choice:  How many hours does it take to cook 15 pieces of Spam in a frying pan? Choices: 1, 2, 3, 4,5 answer: 4 <Multiple Choice:> Multiple Choice:  What animal eats an elephant? Choices:  Elephant, lion, tiger, rhino, cheetah, gorilla answer: lion <Multiple Choice>  <Your question> 1

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by only a few people recently? Choices:  A: train station B: house C: cupboard D: cricket stadium E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>This problem refers to a ventilation fan in a public venue. This should give clues that the multiple choice answers are related to a public building. All venues have ventilation systems, so we can rule options A, C, and D out. A cupboard is a place where people could hide from other people, while a cricket stadium is typically not visited by that many people. A train station is quite crowded, so option B is the correct choice.<n><n>### Demo 2:<n>Input:Where is it the least likely that you’ll trip? Choices: 1. A: In between chairs 2. B: Inside cupboards 3. C: In front of a door 4. D: On the threshold 5. E: In front of a fire 6. F: In front of a window G: In a room with carpeting H: On a staircase I: In a small room<n>Answer: A: In-between chairs B: Front of a door C: In front of the threshold D: On a stair case C: Infront of a fire H: Inside carpeted room<n><n>### Input<n>Another problem with a different choice format describes how most likely you'll trip in public places. The place mentioned earlier is likely a crowded train station, which is the least likely place to trip without a clear reason.<n><n>### Final Demo<n>Input:How do you get to the station? Choices: A: By jumping out of the window first. B: On the train. C: On foot. D: From a long distance away. E: From the kitchen. <n>Answer: A: By jumpimg out of the window first

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:The king was to meet an ambassador, where would the meet? Choices:  A: court B: dinning room C: throne room D: monarchy E: castle<n><n>### Response:		What a monarchy is, it's a ruling system or political regime in which the king or queen is head of state.<n><n>### Why:<n>Such monarchies often are inherited and passed down from generation to generation, as in an aristocratic dynasty and is often supported by a regency.<n>It will help the one who asked if he needs to pass a test.<n><n>>  ### How to execute:<n>    *  Clone the Repository<n><n>		```<n>		git clone <n>		```<n><n>	This will create one local copy of the repository.<n><n>Once that is done, open the terminal in your local machine in which you want to run your script.<n>In this repository there is a "run.sh" file.<n>Run that file, using the following command on your command line.<n><n>		```	<n>		./run.sh<n>		```<n>### Output:<n>	<n>![alt text](https://github.com/momar-souleiman/intro_node_js/blob/master/output/output1.png)<n>![alt text](http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-q8MUw6KLfU8/Ud86XWxO7nI/AAAAAAAAB8Y/k9Uo5wcF-aY/s1600/img004.png)<n>![](https://github.<n><n>### Question:<n>**Was this helpful?**<n>If so, you can donate to support my work. Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Where does a person need to get when they have more kids? Choices:  A: compliments B: understand themselves C: life partner D: second chances E: larger house<n><n>### Response:		A, B, C, E, A, B, C, D, E<n><n>[1]:./screenshot.png (screenshot.png)<n>### Instruction<n>- The machine was very intricare, it was quite an wash <n>  - B: apparatus<n>- Where does a person need to <n><n>- A: compliments<n><n>- Life partner<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Riding bike through rough terrain can be dangerous, one could find themselves what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: accident C: get somewhere D: hurt E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		A:<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Where does a spoon go on one side of a plate? Choices:  A: bowl of soup B: serving dish C: table setting D: placemat E: glass of iced tea<n><n>### Response:		Bowl of soup<n><n><n>### Description:<n>This is a script-style assessment. You will submit a script that includes the correct answer and the correct number of attempts.<n><n>### What to expect:<n>The output is displayed in the console.<n><n>### Input Format:<n>The first line contains a question and an empty newline.<n><n>The next line contains input.<n><n>The next lines contain questions. After each question, there is a new empty line.<n><n>### Output Format:<n>The first output line should be a line of empty newlines. This format is required because the next lines of output are in a fixed format.<n><n>### Solution:<n>```<n>#!/bin/bash<n>answer=""<n>correct_response=""<n>correct_num=0<n>while [ $# -gt 0 ]; do<n>	first="$(echo $1 | cut -d''-f1)"<n>	last="$(echo $1| cut -d''--complement -f1)"<n><n>	if [ "$first"!= "Answer the following multiple choice" ] || [ "$last"!= "Response:" ]; then<n>		# Not part of the actual question, so move on<n>		correct_num += 1<n>		echo "Correct: "<n>		echo "Num tries: "<n>			echo " $correct_num"<n>		echo "Answer: "<n>		<n>		# Display answer, with its appropriate question number<n>		echo " $answer"<n>		correct_response=$correct_response"$correct_num " $answer	<n><n>	 	# Get next question & answer<n>		correct_res="$(echo "$1" | tr '."' '\"')"<n>		answer="$(echo "$correct_res" | cut -d'"' -f2)"<n>		correct_question="$(echo "$correct" | cut -d '"' --complement -f2)"<n><n>		((correct_num+1))<n>	   	shift<n>	  fi<n>done<n><n># Write answer to screen<n>echo "$correct_response<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:What does a virus primarily do to a person? Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The virus primarily does to a person infect.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Viruses are the program that replicate themselves without the help of the host and then infiltrate it. The virus usually infect the host file without the permission and it replicates itself.<n><n>### Extra Credit:<n>Do you think the virus is still dangerous?<n><n>### Demand:<n>An appliance is a machine that we use in the house such as the stove or the washing machine.  <n>A computer is a machine that you use to interact with the internet.  <n>A box is a machine with four sides and a top and bottom.  <n>A what is a piece of paper or a flat board?  <n>An implement is a tool that you use for a job.<n>

She said if it did not rain she wanted us to go to the park at 2p.m.<n><n>### Input<n>I went to the classroom to get the students ready. Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:What does someone want when having fun with their friends and trying to fit in? Choices:  A: being understood B: beer C: playing around D: hug E: visiting friends<n><n>### Response:		<n>What does someone want when they have fun?<n><n>### Input :An easy way to get the answer you want even if it’s not what you asked for.<n><n>### Input ::  Choices:  A : to play basketball B : to play soccer C : to play football D : to play baseball<n><n>### Response ::  A: D<n>I need to get something out of this<n><n>### Input::  Choices:  C : I need a solution  D : the way we did it before<n><n>### Response::   C : I need a Solution<n><n>### Input  :Choices:  A : What’s the way to fix this problem  B : What was the way to do this<n>C: I need a solution D : We don’t need to fix<n><n>### Response  : C : I need a solutions<n><n>### Input   :  Choices A : Why did you do that to me B : Do you know what you’re doing<n><n>C: I need an answer because I know what I’m doing.<n><n>### Output    : D : We don’<n><n>### Input    : Choices:  A  : How can I get more time? B : Tell me what’s going on. C : I’m trying to find out why I’m not getting what I want<n>D: Please tell me the answer.<n><n>### Response : C: I am trying to figure out why<n><n>### Input       : Choices:  B : What are we looking for A: Why do you care? C: I need the answer and I want to find out. D : I don’t need an answer.<n><n>## Output  : C : I’m just curious about something <n><n>### Input        : Choices: B : What’s going on? C : I’m confused, I want you to tell me.  D  : we’ll have to wait and see what happens<n><n>## Output  ::  B: <n><n>### Important Notes<n>1. All the questions will be like the one given in the question.<n>2. Answer will be a single string<n><n>3. The input data is a string and you may give it to the output as a string or in any other form.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:What can happen to you when eating hamburger from someone that you do not know that does not happen when you usually eat a hamburger? Choices:  A: allergic reaction B: gain weight C: have fun D: heartburn E: food poisoning<n><n>### Response:		 You cannot get food poisoning from eating a hamburger from the same person that you usually eat a hhamburger from.<n><n>### Above:<n>* The question asks for what (apparatus).<n>* The answer was what (apparatus) and not the noun that appeared in the sample input.<n><n>### Input, Response: Input: It was a very funny comedy that we all enjoyed. Choices A, B, and E were incorrect answers because they didn't include "funny" that appeared in the sample text. Therefore, the input that was to be answered was C: comedy.<n><n>### Output, Interaction:The person should confirm if they understood the task.<n><n>## Solution 1<n>  The user prompts the user to answer the question below.<n> <n>  ![Image of the message "Please answer below question for me"](doc/images/image1.png)<n><n>  Then a box appears with an input prompting to choose an option (as a response) from the available options below.<n> <n> ![Image of the input prompting to choose one of the available options](doc/images/message2.png)<n> <n>  The user then selects an option and the A2C engine evaluates and returns an answer.<n> <n>   For example, the user selects option B (answering) as shown below.<n> <n>![The user selects option B, answer the question](doc/images/A2C7.png) <n><n>  An answer is sent to the user to confirm that it is correct.<n> <n>  For example, the output sent to the user is as shown below.<n>  <n> ![Correct answer of the question returned to the user](doc/images/images9.png)<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Where would a ticket help you to get to a different country? Choices:  A: train station B: baseball stadium C: lottery D: movie E: bus<n><n>### Response:		I'd go to the airport and purchase a ticket for an international flight.   <n><n>### Response<n><n>**Answer**: _I'd go to the movie theater. A ticket would get me in._<n><n>### Review<n><n>* [Verb](https://c.wikieducator.org/Verb) - A verb is a word that expresses an action, an occurrence, or a state of being.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:The detective had to analyse all the clues, every little thing at the scene he had to what? Choices:  A: look at B: write down C: learn new D: think about E: discovery of new<n><n>### Response:		The machine was very complicated, it was a complicated apparatus.<n><n>### Demo:<n>```<n>@test "should be able to return a correct response to a question" do<n>  response = "answer to a question"<n>  result = QuestionAnswerer.response(response)<n><n>  assert(result == response)<n>end<n>```<n><n>### Demo2:<n>```<n>@spec answer_to_a_question(question_text)<n>  def answer_to_a(question) do<n>    do<n>      result = "answer to a specific question"<n><n>      IO.puts result<n>    end<n>  end<n>```<n><n>## Running the tests<n><n>You can install the dependencies with `mix deps.get` and you can `run` the tests with `mix test`.<n><n>## Contributing<n><n>1. Fork it!<n>2. Create your feature branch: `git checkout -b my-new-feature`<n>3. Commit your changes: `git commit -m 'Add some feature'`<n>4. Push to the branch: `git push origin my-new-feature'`<n>5. Submit a pull request :D<n><n>## Running the dev server<n><n>Run `mix run` for development and for help run `mix help` on the command line.<n><n>## Credits<n><n>This codebase is from a Kattis course [BFSU0](https://www.kattis.com/en/problem_list/bfsu0/). The problem is [here](https://open.kattis.org/problems/bfsu0).<n><n>This codebase adapted from a Kattis code [code0-bfsu](https://github.com/jordanhanson/code0-bfsu).<n><n>This is created by [Jordan Hanson](https://github.questionanswererproject)<n><n>## License<n><n>The code in this project is available under the [MIT License](http://mit-license.org/).<n><n>Copyright (c) 2021 Jordan Hanson

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:A shower is an expected amenity when you reserve a what? Choices:  A: gy mnasiu m B: motel room C: seashore D: bath room E: locker room<n><n>### Response:		<n>When you reserve a room at a motel, you likely expect an expected amenity - a shower! <n><n>A shower is an unexpected amenity at a seashore. You likely won't find the amenity in a bathroom, either; locker rooms have few amenities. <n><n>A showers are an expected amenity; gy mnasiu m doesn't make a lot of sense. <n><n>A motel room has a bathroom and possibly a shower, too.<n><n>### Input<n>What is an instrument that measures the concentration of another substance? Choices: A: A meter B: Meter C: Thermostat D: Balance E: Galley<n><n>### Response<n>A galley has knobs and controls, like a thermostat.<n><n>There are various types of meters, and a thermostat is a type of thermometer. <n><n>A balance is a measuring instrument or tool, but we're looking for a noun here.  <n><n>Galleys don't have things like knobs to control what they're doing. <n><n>### Input What is a device used to convert electrical energy to light, or vice versa? Choices: A. Lamp B. Switching System C. Transformer, D. Light Bulb. E. GPS <n><n>### Response When converting electrical energy to light energy, or the opposite (converting electrical energy into the energy of light), a transistor is used. <n><n>A switch is used to open and close contacts in the circuit as electric current flows through the circuit. <n><n>An automatic switching system is used to control the lighting of an area. <n><n>A lamp can be powered by either an electric current or a light. <n><n>## Input <n>Which of the following is true of automatic systems? Choices: A) they allow a business worker maximum control B) It allows for rapid response C ) It'd an electronic control system. D) It's a safety system. E) It's both a control and a safety system. <n><n>## Response A automated system reduces the need for physical control, allowing workers more control over operations than ever.  <n><n>This is why an automatic system is superior to an old computer control system; it is controlled by touch or voice instead of being controlled by your

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:When a monkey is taken away from their home they are often brought to this place where people wear white coats. Choices:  A: rain forest B: research laboratory C: cage D: treetops E: south africa<n><n>### Response:		<n>This has to be a laboratory. Monkeys are the subject of many research studies.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>When monkeys are taken away from their habitat they are usually taken to areas far away where they are studied in laboratories and not released back into the wild. The laboratories where monkeys are taken are often covered in white so that scientist can spot any signs of sickness or disease.<n><n>### Input:(3 points) The Monkey and the Cage The monkey climbs out of the cage and then the scientist traps the monkey again in the cage, however the monkey escapes and does this again. The scientist has to catch the monkey or release the monkey back into the wild. Choices:  Eat the scientist's brains.  Escape the cage.  Rejoin its family and play the guitar in the rain forest.  Sneak out of the cage in the dark and go to the next town where the zoo cages no longer exist.  Become a musician and play in a symphony orchestra in Chicago.<n><n>### Response:(1 point) Escape the cage<n><n>### Explation:<n>This is the most creative and also most logical. The monkey is clearly bored of its life imprisonment in a cage and wants to run around freely, and there is no other way to get free. The monkey can run far away, or it is the scientist that has to do the leg work. Neither way is realistic or what the monkey wants.<n><n>### (2 points)  The Monkey and the Ship  One day the monkey is taken on a ship from its home to Africa, a very sad monkey that hates his owner. Then one day the monkey is locked in a cold room with only a little piece of meat and nothing else to eat. The monkey has to go through this everyday forever. The monkey can do this forever or the monkey can escape and go back home.<n><n>### Explain the choices:<n>Going through the horrifying daily routine where the monkey is taken away or where it is tortured until it goes mad is better than being in the wild where the monkeys is in danger of being shot and killed by hunters. The monkey can escape and become a free-thinking

(i.e. "How stupid can you be!?!" "Are you an idiot!")<n>* It must have the option to change its voice<n>* No ad bots<n>* The bot must be hosted somewhere that I can easily call it from my PC. (i.e Gitee/GitHub/GitLab/FTP/etc)<n><n>Examples:<n>```<n>@bot is correct<n>```<n>* This response can be either `@guest [correct answer]`, `@Bot [correct answer]`, or `@[Bot's Voice][correct answer]`<n><n>```<n>@not_correct not a answer<n>```<n>* This should respond to incorrect answers only, and should not respond to `none of the above`<n><n>### Categories:<n><n>* Easy<n>* Medium<n>* Hard<n>* Very Hard<n><n>### Easy<n><n>![Easy](https://d2h9s10nvvuc17y.cloudfront.net/07299/5d2cbc43163a421680ac00b7/large.gif)

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Sam didn't like the people he met while traveling.  What might he do to get away from them? Choices:  A: come home B: airplane C: learn from each other D: go out E: make art<n><n>### Response:		The response should include one or more code blocks that solve the problem.<n><n>#### Expected Solution<n>In our example, we assume that the user can type. The user is writing a sentence, and we need to decide what punctuation should be used to create that sentence without a capital letter after "Woman in yellow dress".<n><n>Our solution replaces all words with a capital letter, and replaces punctuation. The outputted string is then sent to a "readLine()" function, which returns it.<n><n>A more robust way of solving this is by using a regular expression. A Regex for solving this would be "/(?!M)[^A-Z]+$/".<n><n>The code is shown below:<n>```<n>String input = "The machine was very intricate......";<n>input = input.replaceAll("(?!M)[^a-z]$", "");<n>System.out.println(input);<n>```<n><n>### Hints<n>- Use an if-else statement to determine if the string should start with a capital letter and whether the string has punctuation.<n>- The response should include one or multiple code blocks that can solve the problems.<n>- Be sure to ask for clarification if you need it.<n><n>### Expected Output<n><n>```<n>The machine was very intricately.........<n>The machine was very intracately.........<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:What prevents someone from getting sleep at night? Choices:  A: relax B: dreams C: have nightmares D: restlessness E: snore<n><n>### Response:		C: have nightmareses<n><n>### Input<n>What is the difference between a "diamond" and a "heart"?<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>### Input:"How are you feeling?” Choices:  A:"terrible B: "great C:"sick D:"awesome E:"alright<n><n>### Response:"B"<n><n>### Input:'Did the plane take off on time?'<n><n>### Response:`False`<n><n>### Input'the police will be coming in a minute'<n><n>### Response'I'm excited'<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: The baby began to cry. Choices:  A:(1), A:(2) Choices:  B:(3), B:(4) I am not sure. Choices:  C:(5), C:(6) I left the house. Choices:  D:(7), D:(8) They will be here soon.<n>Answer: B:"They will be here soon."<n><n>### Instuction<n><n>### Demo<n>We met one another last night.<n><n>### Demo Response<n>We met last night. - "We met one another".<n><n><n>### DemoResponse<n><n>### Demo 1<n><n>### Demo2<n><n>### Demo3<n><n><n>### Demotest<n>1. 'Tell me the answer.', <n>1.'Tell me the answer.'<n><n>2.'When do you need help'?, <n>2. 'When do you need help?',<n><n>1.'How many people should join this project?'<n><n>1.'How may people will join this project'.<n>

Choices: A: unwise B: poor C: wicked D: silly E: good<n><n>### Response :<n>Answer: A: unwise<n><n>### Input  :What I don’t like here is, the booking is not what? Choices: a: open A: open B: good C: closed D: closed<n><n>### Response  :<n>Answer: C: closed<n><n>## #680598369034<n>Instructions:<n><n>## Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n>- When I go to the library to check out a book, I have to go to where first? Choices: A) the counter B) the bookshelf C) the bookcase D) the reference room E) the circulation desk<n>- In what department of the store is stationery located? Choices: A} the sales department B) the produce department C) the accounting department D) the personnel department E) the personnel office<n>- At the supermarket, the first item to be scanned is the one with what kind of barcode? Choices: A. circular B. square C. irregular D. round E. rectangular<n>- At what counter is the book titled "A Good Read" located? Choices: a. the fiction reference counter b. the non-fiction fiction counter c. the biography reference counter d. the fiction reference desk e. the history reference counter<n>- ________is the person you talk to when you have a question or you want something. Choices: A. an operator B. a manager C. an assistant D. an office manager E. a clerk<n><n>## Demonstration (write the line of code to run)<n><n>Instructions:Write a response below the demo and use the given format to write your response. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Where is a snake likely to reside? Choices:  A: tropics B: nightmare C: wyoming D: bushes E: feild<n><n>### Response:		<n>I like B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a program that will calculate area of a circle given the diameter of the circle.  The diameter of the circle will be an integer in the form of a String.  The calculated area will also be a string.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: The diameter of the circle is 5.6 meters <n><n>### Output  <n><n>Output:<n>5.6<n><n>### Demination<n>When the diameter of the circle is less than 1000, then the circle should display the number of feet, inches, and sixteenth inches (16 in).<n>When the diameter of circle is over 1000 it should display how many feet and inches.<n>To complete this, you will need to know the formula for Circle area<n><n>### Example<n><n>  When the diameter of the circle = 5.6 m,<n>The formula for the area of a circle = π * r²<n>Then the result is 3.14<n>  <n>### Explanation:<n>Circumference of a circle  <n>C = 2 π r <n><n>Area of a circle <n>A = π r² <n><n>### Democracy<n>To create area, you will need to do the following:<n><n>```<n>import java.util.Scanner;<n>import java.lang.*;    <n>```<n>The import statement tells the main method in the main line of code that we will use the java.lang library for data validation.<n><n>```<n>/* The user will input the radius in feet<n>1.) Declare the radius<n>2.) Read into the radius variable using the scanner<n>3.) Input radius<n>4.) Loop<n>5.) Convert the radius into a float<n>6.) Calculate the area using the formula<n>7.) Display the string: the area<n>8.) Repeat<n>*/<n>public class Area {<n> public static void main(String[] args) {<n> Scanner inpt = new Scanner(System.in);<n> String radius = "";<n> float d = 0f;<n> float circumference;<n> float area;<n> float rad = (float) inpt.nextFloat();<n> //float area = 3.14 * (rad);<n> //rad = (float) inpts.nextFloat();<n><n> for (int i = 0; i < rad; i++) {<n>   area

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Where are small grapes used? Choices:  A: picnic basket B: wine press C: juice D: fruit cocktail E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		<n><input type="radio"name="fruits" id="grapes" value="grapes">grapes<n><input type="text"name="fruits_comments" id="grapeseed" value="grapeseed"><n><n>### Instructer:<n>If you click on the fruit and answer a question incorrectly you will get a message saying try again, if you try another fruit it will ask you to input the information again.<n>---<n>##### Instruction: Answer the following multiple choice question and you can give me comments at the bottom<n>```<n>### Demonstraion:<n><n>### Inputs:<n>- grapes<n>  - comments "grapeseed"<n> <n>### Response: grapes<n>---<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple type question and you can give the comments at the bottom<n>### Demonstation:<n>---<n><n>## Comments: grapeseed<n>```javascript<n>const responses = document.querySelectorAll('input[name="fruits"]');<n>responses.forEach(res => {<n>  res.addEventListener('click', () => {<n>    this.parentNode.parentNode.querySelector('.comments')<n>     .lastElementChild.type = "text";<n>      this.parentNode.classList.add("active");<n>  });<n>});<n>```

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:A person is putting on makeup, what is their likely goal? Choices:  A: feel pleasure B: look attractive C: compliments D: interesting experiences E: joy<n><n>### Response:		In this question, there is implicit instruction. Answer choices are not provided, and an unspecified response is sought. When an implied instruction is given, you can respond to the implicit instruction by giving the answer that best meets the implied intention. What is an implicit instruction? An implicit instruction (or unstated question) is not what the examiner stated outright in the question, but is a question that can be inferred on the basis of the examiner's statements about the context and task. <n><n>### Demostration:<n>You can use these hints to help you answer the implicit instruction: • The task requires someone to look attractive. <n><n>## Solution:-<n>Input: The machine is intricate. It is an what? Choices A, B, C, E and D. <n><n>Output: The machine is intricacy. It is a B. Apparatus. (It is a term used to describe a machine, tool or device.)<n><n>Input: The bride is dressed for her wedding. She looks A is looking attractive, B she is dress for her wedding, C happy, D dressed in a long flowing wedding gown, E happy and is looking attractive/dresses for her wedding.<n><n>Output: The bride looks attractive because she dress up for her wedding. He said that you're better off if you stand in line at the store because then you avoid the agony of having to wait. While waiting may not be "the best choice" it certainly is the only choice. And in the meantime, you don't have to worry over whether you can find a place to park. Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:He finally found someone as ugly as him, knowing he wouldn't be the one sticking out was what? Choices:  A: gorgeous B: handsome C: pleasing D: glorious E: pretty beautiful<n><n>### Response:		It was easy not to stick out.<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>If you were wondering whether that person is attractive or not, read this line aloud and you will easily know she is not beautiful.<n><n>### Analysis:<n>Input<n>Beautiful = "beauty"<n>Pretty = "pretty"<n><n>Answer<n>No<n><n>### Input<n>Whether you like her or not, she is not going to make you pretty.<n><n>### Response<n>She probably won’t make me pretty even if her beauty is not what I like.<n><n>### Input -<n>It looks as though a man had painted himself into a corner and could easily go from there to what? Choices:<n>A: The floor B: The floor C: Out the window D: A corner<n>(I'm confused. Doesn't this sentence describe something else?)A: The floor<n><n>### Analysis -<n>He is talking about a painting. He feels he can walk out to the corner, then back to the painting where he can walk off the floor.He is in a painted corner and he can't get out. This means that he will walk back to where he started in the painting(corner on the floor), and then walk to the ceiling (The painted corner). This is like someone saying, "I can't eat just one(cookie) and then after eating a cookie you will have eaten one cookie.<n><n>### Solution -<n>A: The floor<n>

C++ supports multiple interfaces.<n><n>### Option 4, 5 is NOT true.<n><n>### C++ Supports multiple Inheritance but does NOT support multiple Interfaces!<n><n>---

What might the cops do to him? Choices:  A: going to jail B: going to prison C: beat him up D: get arrested E: die<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the cops find out, they might send Jim to jail or beat him.<n><n>### Output:<n>He might die<n><n><n>### Input and Response:<n>Input: The washing machine broke down and the husband was out of town and his wife was sick and not able to deal with it. Choices: A; Her husband was at home but his wife couldn’t get him to fix the washing machine B: He fixed it himself C: The repairman fixed it D: The repairman tried and just made it worse<n>Answer: A: Her husband was at home<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Your job is to write a response code that does not already exist which will output a message containing the correct response.<n><n>### If the husband was at home:<n>The cops might take him to jail or to prison depending on what he did.<n><n>### Example:<n>If the husband works all the time: The cops might take him home and make him  go to jail for working all the time.<n><n>### The response will always be a valid choice<n><n><n>### Example Response Code<n>```<n>if(copsFindOut){<n>    response = "Jim might go to jail or to be toaten.";<n>    return response;<n>}<n><n>else if(jimwasntatHome){<n>    response = Jim is in his house.<n>    return response; <n>}<n><n>else{ <n>    response = Jim should die.<n>    return response ; }<n>```<n><n><n>### Output and Instruction<n>Output: Jim should have been home when his washing machine broke. Choices: A: Yes B: No C: He should learn how to fix washers D: Other <n><n><n>### Instruct: If he did he might<n><n>### Output<n>Jim should have been home when the washing machine broke. If he did, then he might be at home or dead, or jail or prison.<n><n>### Comment<n>We have to use "if","else", and "else if" to construct this function.<n><n>### Note: These instructions are only an "Example" and will cause a "Failed Test Response" if executed exactly. For proper "Test" instructions, go to the "test.py" file.<n><n>### Next step (after this code is compiled and executes

Choices:  A-c C-c E-e B-a D-a<n><n>### Choice:A. grassy field B. the forrest C. inside joke D.Tennessee E. england<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Write complete, grammatically correct sentences with correct subject-verb agreement as indicated in context.<n><n><n>## Input: Write the correct subject-verb agreement: The cat chases the dog. Choices: A. was chasing B. is chasing C. was chased D. is being chased E. chases the dog F. both B and D<n><n>## Output: The cat chases ___. A: B: C: D: E: is incorrect because windows are not the primary supporting columns and the building. If the foundation is not strong enough to support the building or if the windows are made of inferior materials  the windows will not matter.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:I am looking to buy honey right from an apiary, where should I go? Choices:  A: jar B: stick to fingers C: beehive D: stick to fingers E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		<n>Go to farmer's market.<n><n>### Input : I am thinking of going to the park for a day and spending some time there. Where will that be? Choices:<n>A: at B: for C: time D: the park E: time<n><n>### Response : (answer will remain different for each question, use a if then else to solve this for every question. )<n>If (answer1 == "for")<n>{<n>answer2 = "the park";<n>else if (answer1 == "at")<n>{<n>answer = "the park";  <n>}<n>else if (answer  == "time")<n>{<n>answer ="The park";<n>}}

Choices:  A: school B: office building C: house D: hotel E: centre<n><n>### Response:		<n>He had a hard time findt he room, it was on the 2nd floor of a very large school (school – singular)<n><n>### Input : A lot of people came to the meeting, it wasn't as if that it wasn't very important. Choices:  A : hard to B : small C : easy D : simple E : not very nice<n><n>### Response<n>It was easy to find his classroom because it was near the front. Choices:  C : easy D : hard <n><n>### Input He arrived 20 minutes to the party, he didn't want go to the party. Choices:  a : to the early to  b : late to  a : early b : late c: in time  d c: on time e : not early enough <n><n>### Response The class started and there was a lot of noise. There were also only 4 chairs left out of all the empty ones. Choices: 1: No chairs 2: The class had started <n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: In a very few seconds he arrived at the restaurant, a few weeks earlier he had promised he would go to the restaurant. Choices:  I: he had gone to the restaurant A: yes  II: no B: No<n><n>Output: Choices:  I : yes or no B: no C: yes  D: not necessary E: that depends<n><n>### Input The professor said the final exam results were going to posted in two weeks, the results were on a very important project. Choices:  i: not so important  ii: more important  iii: unimportant  <n><n>### Response You did a really poor job at the project, how you going to do better next semester?<n><n>### Instuctions:Answer the following multiple-choice question. <n>### Demonstatration:<n>Input:The class started and there was still a lot of people in the classroom, the class had not run out of people yet. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:A person with brown skin may share that skin with whom? Choices:  A: finger B: good health C: own family D: friends E: people<n><n>### Response:		<n>The best answer is A) finger because the word'skin' is used to describe only the person, not anyone else.<n><n>### Input<n>The old man was sick and weak in body. How can we describe him? Choices: 	A: He was a muscular man. B: He was old and decrepit. C: He was fat and tall. D: He was lean and young. E: He was frail and thin.<n><n>### Response<n>The best answer is C) He was fat and tall because the man is described as being overweight because of the words 'was fat and tall', not lean or thin.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Someone who is awake is likely to know what's going on because they are this? Choices:  A: alert B: deep sleep C: drink coffee D: open eyes E: conscious<n><n>### Response:		<n>> The machine was very intricacies and it was quite an apparatus.<n><n>### Explanation<n>The machine was not anything. The word what refers to a sentence in which the correct verb needs to follow next. What refers to a sentence which requires a complement. For apparatus, we need the structure complement + object + a relative pronoun so we need what not was.<n><br>In English we can have two options<n><n><img src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33680992/64800279-4596d180-c249-11e9-9f60-281207f81679.png" width="500"><n><n>In Japanese, the relative pronoun is always there: __what/who__<n><n><img src = "https://user-images-prod.google.com/img/url?q=https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/3d/Wiithwho.png&w=332&h=228&crop-src=https://upload.waikato.ac.nz/media/h/h/2/254b1584c57ce17cf4a2f2220bac72ed/1/a/7/3/w/w/who%203.jpg&w=334&h=230&s768-px750-w320-crop-w320&s769-px750&auto=webp&t=a_img44a1526" width = 500><n><n><n>__Complement - object - relative pronoun__ is always there.<n><n>

The machine was quite an apparatus.<n><n><n>## The response should not be a complete sentence. Do not place a period (.) at the end of the response.<n><n>### Write a response.<n>Example: A. The machine was quite big.<n>B. The machine took up a lot of space.<n><n><n>### Write another response.<n>Example: The machine was quite loud.<n><n>### Complete the task below with your own response<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demostration <n><n>### Input <n><n>### Response<n><n>### Complete<n><n>### Write Another Response<n><n>### Write 1 more response<n><n>### Add<n><n>### Check<n><n>### Write One More Responce<n><n>### Add Another Response<n>

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Where might you have cake with your ice cream? Choices:  A: earth B: movie C: party D: served cold E: freezer<n><n>### Response:		Where we got the ice cream.<n><n>### The user requested the response above in the context described in  the task.<n><n>#### Write instructions that describe the task in which the user inputs a location into a text box that the user would use to describe the location.<n><n>#### Demonstrate how to receive the user input that satisfies the task's description by completing the following instruction. (Notice: The input does not satisfy the task's description in this demonstration.)<n><n>##### Instruction:Answer what you can in this conversation.<n><n>##### Demonstration:(Do not complete the conversation.)<n>Input: Where might you find some great seafood dinners? Choices:  The user's response: Where would we find the fish?<n><n>### Input:(Note: The user's input does not answer the question. It is acceptable if you do not answer the question.)<n>Where can we find fish?<n><n>## The user responded with an input that satisfied the task's description. (Note: Input A satisfies the description when the user does not mention fish. Input B satisfies the description when the input mentions fish by saying "by the seaside." )<n><n>### Instructions:Select the input given in the description below and modify it to answer the question. Choices:  Your response: Arizona<n><n>Input: Which is your home state?<n><n>### The demonstration describes a task that the user can solve by answering the question above in the chosen response format.<n><n>### Input the selected response format and then modify the format. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:If one sees a fox and is standing in a coastal, gulf state, where is this person? Choices:  A: alabama B: louisiana C: south carolina D: arkansas E: mountains<n><n>### Response:		If one sees a fox in the coastal, gulf states, of B or C, that person is in South Carolina. Choices:  A and D B: and E <n><n>### Input:"It was a long drive, but a few minutes later, the road started to slop downward." Where does this road end? Choices: <n><n>### Response:"This section is correct but your answer lacks details to make sure that the audience can follow the instructions."<n><n><n>### Instructions: You will be given a sentence or a question. Complete the sentence with another sentence or question that appropriately describes an appropriate response.<n><n>### Input:(1)If a car is parked in the driveway, when should you expect someone to arrive?Choices:A: the next<n><n>### Response:(2)After you have put the groceries in the refrigerator the next step is to wash your hands.<n><n><n>### Input (1)How long does it take to finish this task?<n>Choices:<n><n>### Response (2)You should finish this task as soon as possible before it gets dark.<n><n><n>## Expectations:<n><n>* To use vocabulary effectively by expanding upon and refining vocabulary and phrases provided to complete a specific task, as demonstrated in your response.<n>* To appropriately utilize and incorporate all parts of speech to complete the task, as demonstrated by your response.<n>* Demonstrate the ability to use grammatical rules in order to write a response to a given instruction or prompt, as demonstrated by your choice of words or phrases to appropriately complete each sentence to ensure meaningfulness for an audience.<n>* To use proper capitalization, punctuation, and spelling for clarity in a sentence or paragraph.<n><n>### Output:<n><n><n>### The final response.<n><n>## Examples:<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>Response to:<n><n>### Instructor Response:<n>The sentence was vague and unclear. It lacked specificity.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Where might a yard be tiny? Choices:  A. green and square B. square and rectangular C. rectangle and green D. green and round E. green and round <n><n>###Instruction Response: It was round and green<n>###A rectangle is a two-dimensional object with four right angles. <n>###A square is a two-dimensional (2D) quadrilateral bounded by four (4), or more, straight sides which are similar in length and form four right angles. 2D means that the object exists on a plane (for example, a flat surface, such as a sheet of paper), but it has no thickness.<n>###A circle is curvy, and it has no corners or straight sides to mark off even spaces

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:After new coke was discontinued what formula was used? Choices:  A: original B: old C: coke clear D: former E: familiar<n><n>### Response:		After new coke was discontinuing there was a new coke that was used which contained a cola concentrate. It was introduced in Colombia as “Bright Coke.”<n><n>### Input What did the old coke taste like? Choices: 	A: sweet B: salty C: tart D: acidic E: tasteless<n>Answer: B: salty<n><n>### Inference:<n>New coke was introduced after the discontinuation of old coke. Old coke was introduced by phillip Morris. The only change made to the old coke was the formula was switched from being sweet to being salty.<n>### Evaluation: In 1985, phillip Morris was looking for a way to differentiate their brand. New coke was introduced to try and compete with the competitors. However, the taste preference of people did not change and Coca Cola came up by doing a public demonstration of the old coke after it was introduced with people saying a salty taste.<n><n>---<n>#### Credits: <n><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CtRQD3u7jUA" target="_blank"><img width="200" height="200" src="https://github.com/VinothRaj/VinothRaju/blob/master/Images/video%20title.png?raw=true" alt="video title.png?raw=ture"></a><n><a href="http://www.coca-colagallery.com/displays/coca-cola-history-partner" target="_blank"> <img width="500" height="500" style="display:block; margin-left:auto; margin-right:auto;" src="http://i.imgur.com/z2ZW1WL.png"/> </a><n><a id="img2fdb8a0252834a0a82c73f51c619a6d8-fdb8a098570042809a29d5d8ec5a3cfa" target="_blank" href="http://www2.slideshare.net/Anandaraj

Choices:  A: dicks sporting goods B: sporting event C: mall D: sears E: sporting goods store<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: where they are all going to play in the playoffs? B: at the store where they just got home after the game. C: where the teams play. D: where they just went to get their last equipment to use for the playoffs. E: at their houses.<n>### Output:<n>A: dicks sporting good B: sporting good C: sears D: mall E: the playoff<n><n>### Instructions:<n>I found 25 books in the library and 20 of them were novels. Now, I want to read 80% of those books. I've been reading in a very relaxed fashion and I've got 1000 pages left in each of the novels I've read. Now, I'm doing 200 pages per day. If I'm reading a non-novel, I've got 300 pages per day to read. How many more novels do I have to read to meet my goal?<n>**Instructions:** Write a program to respond to the above question, using the variables and math.<n><n>### Input / Output:<n>Input / Output: The instructions.<n><n>### Result:<n>My result is, 7 Novel left.<n><n>### Example:<n>Input: The library has 130000 books in it and 80% of them are books. I've read 20% of them. I've got 200 pages left in a novel that I am reading. I should be able to read 200 pages in 200 minutes. For non-novels, it is about 300 pages in 300 minutes. How many more novals do I need to finish what?? Choices: A: read B: read<n><n>### Input :What is the question? Choices: A: the most novels B: how many more novels C: the most novels D: I get to read E: the question<n><n><n>### Output: What is the output? Choices: A B C D E<n><n>### Program: I found 25 books, 2000 pages. I will get 20 novel 2000/200=20/1=20.<n><n>### Examples

Choices:  A: farm B: ancient rome C: history book D: poor countries E: plantation<n><n>### Response:		A: farm<n><n>### Demostraitin & Instruction:<n>- The machine was very intricates, it was quite an apparatus that was the the machine. What was the name of one of the institutions?<n>- In one of the states, a law was passed stating that no slave shall learn to read or write.<n>- Which choice is right: it was a wash dish or a machine or or implement?<n><n><n>### Instructtion:What were the three primary types of trials established in the United States?<n><n>### Demstration:<n>- The machine worked very well, it was quite an implement that produced a lot of goodness.<n>- Which choice was apparatus, the wash dish, or implement?<n>- Which choice was right: it was apparatus, apparatus, or implement?<n>The machine was very intricate and so was the the apparatus.<n>The washdish, the implement, and the the machine were all apparatus.<n><n>### Input/Output:<n>What were the three primary trials established in the united states?<n>Choices:  A: capital punishment B: civil liberties C: due process D: speedy trial E: not guilty<n><n>### Input and Instruction:A law was passed stating that a slave shall not learn to read or write in Massachusetts.<n>- Which choice described a slave who was not allowed to learn to read and was instead restricted to a specific type of work?<n>- Which choice did the slave who was not allowed on learn to read or write choose?<n>- What were the three primary trips established in the united?<n><n>- **D** A law was passed stating that slaves shall not learn to read nor to write. <n>- **C** There is a difference in slaves who are allowed to do work while some who are not allowed to, so you can't put a slave who is not allowed learn while it is slaves.<n>- There were civil liberties, speedy trial, due process, and capital punishment.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>- The machine wasn't very intricate and so it was an apparatus that produced and it was quite an appliance.<n>- An implement is a small machine.<n>- A wash dish is a machine

Ask these questions: Where would you go to put your keys to remember?<n><n>Where do you keep a pencil? Where would you put your keys to remember them from being misplaced?<n><n>### Demination: <n>An answer should be given to the two questions given.<n><n>### Assessment: <n>Students are expected to be able to answer the question.  They should be able to remember locations of items frequently used.<n><n>### Lesson:  <n>Students who have trouble with finding their home to start using routines. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Why do people engage in chatting with friends in class? Choices:  A: necessity B: answers C: inspiration D: love E: fun<n><n>### Response:		A: necessity<n><n>### Why are there certain parts of the house that make you shiver? Choices:  Choices: A: because some of them are broken B: because they are dusty C: because cold air gushes from D: because they are damp E: because they were not built well<n><n>### Response A: because they were not build well<n><n>GIVEN-INPUT<n>```<n>The machine was very intricate. It was quite an<n>__________________.<n>```<n><n>GIVEN WRONG-INPUT<n>```python <n>def input_checker():<n>   """Input Checker"""<n>    input1=""<n>    input11=""<n>    print("Choose your answer")<n>    while True:<n>        ans=input().title()<n>        if ans=='a':\<n>            input1=input1+input11+ans<n>            print('CORRECT' )<n>            break<n>        elif ans=='b':<n>            input11=input11+ans+input1<n>            print('Correct')<n>        elif ans==c':<n>            if input11=='':<n>                print('ERROR')<n>        else:<n>            print('ERROR')<n>```<n><n>```python<n>output=input_checker()<n>input_checker() #RUN THE PROGRAM<n>print(output) #PRINT OUTPUT<n>```<n>### INPUT<n>```python<n>  CORRECT<n>```<n>### OUTPUT<n>```<n><n>The machine was very _______________. Choices: A: box B: Apparatus C: Appliance D: wash Dishes E: implement<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:If something is obtuse, what couldn't it be? Choices:  A: bright B: pointed C: correct D: acute angled E: clear<n><n>### Response:		B: pointed<n><n>### Instructions: The word is a 7 letter word that begins with the letter Q and ends with the letter E. You can rearrange the letters U, N, P, N, R, and E to obtain a 5 letter word which begins with the letter S and ends with the letter R. What is the word?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: UNPRENEER - PRENEER is a 5 letter word that begins with S and ends with R<n><n>### Response - (please type here)<n><n><n><n>### Input and Demostration for solution - PRENEER<n>UNPRENEER is a permutation of PRENEER<n><n>### Instructon: <n>Given a 4 letter word, change each letter's position in the word without changing the sequence of the letters and without using any of the letters more than once to obtain a 5 word that begins with the leftmost letter in the original word. What is the word and which letter is leftmost in the word?<n><n>Input and Demostration - PRIDE<n>Input: PIDE - change each letter's location in the word without repeating any letters.<n><n><n>### Solution:<n>(please type the solution here)<n><n>### Instuctio:<n>Given a single word, change a letter and all of its successors in the word so that a new and different word is obtained. The new word is formed by replacing the first letter in the original word with the letter which is the third in the alphabet from the letter of the original word which precedes the first. What is the new word and what is the third letter in the alphabet from G?<n><n>### Solution<n>(please type response here)<n><n>Input and Demonstration - DECO<n><n>Input: DECO - Replace the letter DE with CO then replace the letter C with O<n><n>### Instraction:<n><n>Input: The word is a single word of five letters which include an "A" and an "E" but does not include an "I" or a "Y". No matter what letters you insert into the word to satisfy the letter positions you still have the exact word, what is the word?<n>Input and Demo - GESTURE<n><n>### Solution - (please type response here):<n><n>The word we

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:The children saw superman fly overhead, what did they exclaim as a result? Choices:  A: ouch B: skip C: enjoyed D: awesome E: watch television<n><n>### Response:		The children saw supermen fly overhead, they exclaimed it was great!<n><n>### Question:What was the result of the experiment performed by the scientists on their newly found plant? Choices: <n>A: It was so powerful that it brought on a fever B: It made the scientists weak C: It was the plant being tested on them D: The effects were unknown<n><n>### Answer:The experiment brought on by the scientists resulted in illness, the plant was poisonous.<n><n>------<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple choose question.<n>### Demontration: <n><n>#### Question:How do you know if its possible to take a plane from your city to a close by destination or even to a different city?<n><n>##### A: By looking on a map <n><n>##### B: By looking on the TV and reading the newspaper <n><n>##### C: By talking to the person who owns the airline. <n><n>##### D: By checking on the Internet and using the computer to find out the dates available on which you can travel to that destination. <n><n>#### Answer: By checking on the internet.<n><n>--------------------------<n><n>### Instutions:Answer the following multiple- choice question<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>##### Question:How do you tell how big a number is? <n><n>##### A : By cutting it in half <n><n>#####B : By adding up the numbers from one to it.<n><n>#####C : By comparing its size to a number that is known <n><n>#####D : By using the number line<n><n>##### Answer: By comparing its size to another number<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:The human looked down longingly as he sat in the orbiting space station, what did he miss? Choices:  A: nearest house B: workplace C: surface of earth D: office block E: his feet<n><n>### Response:		D: office block<n><n>### Explanation: The following sentence describes an object. It asks for information about the object. The answer is 'office block'. <n>For instance, if it is a ball, it would be: 'What color is the ball?'. If it is a bicycle, it would be: What shape is the bicycle?'. If it is an orange, it would be:What kind of fruit is the orange?'. The first part of each sentence is the question. The person making the request will give the response, "apparatus". That person is called the 'interrogator'. This is one of many multiple choice tasks. You will find more in future chapters.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:The clothing was extremely expensive compared to other places, where was it likely purchased? Choices:  A: cinema hall B: mall C: department store D: closet E: shop<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```<n>@apparatus = answer.downcase<n>```<n><n>### Output: What kind of clothing was it?:<n><n>```<n>@response = "expensive clothing was likely purchased at a mall"<n>```<n><n>## Task 1<n><n>Write a response that appropriately answers the following question:<n><n>  Question:What is the next day according to your schedule?:<n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>input = Schedule<n>```<n><n>## Output<n><n>```<n>@output = (input[0..2].join(", "))<n>```<n><n>## A task that is used to check if the data can be formatted into another value, or if there is not enough information to determine the other value.<n><n>  Example:<n><n>```<n># You are on the phone with a friend:<n><n>friend = Schedule<n><n># your friend says:<n>"What time does your school end today?"<n><n># you say:<n>"I am not sure. It is probably late in the afternoon by the time it gets out."<n>```<n><n>## Example Output:<n><n>```<n>friend = Schedule() # this is all day until your parent picks you up at 5PM.<n><n>@output = "I am not sure. Schedule seems to end around 5PM."<n>```<n><n>

I don't know how long it's been, but it's a few hours.  And my heart races when I look into your eyes.  It's like I know how lucky I am to have you and for you to see me for who I am and for who we are and we are lucky to be together. That's a feeling. That's a wonderful feeling and it's something that I love to have that feeling all the time. And sometimes I even forget, but then it's like all at once it's like it's like I'm feeling grateful right now, like when I look into your gaze.  So that makes me know I'm just thankful. I'm so thankful that there's someone who loves me just as I am. And that's something that I could never take for granted.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:If I have a forgiving attitude toward someone, what do they receive? Choices:  A: redemption B: isolation C: absolution D: great relief E: feel better<n><n>### Response:		Input: The machine was made in the US, but was eventually sold to what country? Choices:  USA China Japan UK<n>### Answer: The correct answer is India. If an option does NOT contain the entire choice, please include the missing word in your response. Otherwise an option does NOT contain any part of the choice<n>### If the correct answer is the same as an option choose the closest answer<n>### If there is no correct answer, type N/A.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>[The machine was very intricate...., it was quite an _______.](http://i.imgur.com/u114GqY.jpg)<n><n>If I have a ______________attitude toward someone, what do thet receive?<n><n>[If the correct answer is the smae as an option choose the _____________ answer.](http://i.imgur,com/XBG12Ht.jpg)<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:A student wants to hear what the professor is saying, what does he do? Choices:  A: gain experience B: taking notes C: listen carefully D: complete test E: focus<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>*A student wants to hear that a professor is saying, what is he doing?*  <n><n>`Gaining experience.`  <n>`Listen carefully.`  <n>`Complete test.`  <n>`Focus.`  <n>`Taking notes.`<n><n>#### Aiming for the next milestone:<n>> It was quite an apparatus.<n><n>### Solution:<n>```c#<n>//Input:The machine was very intricate<n>string machine= "123456789012345";<n>machine= machine.Insert(5, char.Parse(Console.ReadLine()).ToString());<n>Console.WriteLine(machine);<n><n>//Output:It was quite an what?<n><n>static string Answer (string Machine)<n>{<n>    Console.WriteLine("It was quite an " + Machine.SubString(Machine.Find("what?")).Trim());<n>    return "It was quite an "<n>        + Machine.SubString<n>        (Machine.Find("what!"));<n>}<n><n>static void Main(string[] args)<n>{<n>    Answer(machine);<n>}<n>```<n>### Challenge for the next milestone<n><n>- [Instruction:](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18074262/c-sharp-replace-words-in-a-string) **How would you remove all but the last space in a string?**<n>- [Instruction](https://stackoverflow.c/questions/tagged/?tag=C%3A%23) : **[Tagged?](https://stackoverflow.C/questions/tagged) How would you remove leading spaces from each word in a string?**

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Where is a bald eagle safe? Choices:  A: pine tree B: open country C: in washington D: wildlife refuge E: sky<n><n>### Response:		The answer here is C: in washing ton<n><n>### Justification:A bald eagle lives in the wild, in washington it lives in the washington refuge.<n><n>### Input:\<n>What did she do to change her house in to a home? Choices:  \<n>A: replaced old carpet with tile flooring B: paint over blemishes in the wall C: move her belongings in D: put new doors in her house E: add a new color and roof to her house<n><n>### Input, what does a man with his hair cut off look like?<n><n>### Input answer: A man with his hair cut looks like what?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>A man with his hair cut, the man who's hair is cut, the man with a haircut,<n><n>### Demointation:<n>A man who cuts his own hair, he is a mans man.<n><n>### Demo:<n>A man can find his hair cut in barber shop, or in front of his home.<n><n>### Justifications:<n>A man with hair can cut his own or get it done for him.<n><n>A man with his own house can make his house a home.<n><n>A man can wear different styles of hair, from bald to long.<n><n>A man looks well kept when he gets his hair cut at the barber.<n><n>### Incorrect:The answer here is D: put new doors and new roof on his house.<n><n>### Why?<n>A woman with her new home will remodel her house and put new doors and new rooms on it.<n><n>### Correct, the answer here is C: move her belong and paint over blemishes.<n>

"True."<n><n>### Input & Output:You ask a woman if she is in her late 40s or older. She says that she is not, but she may be, or not.<n><n>### Answer:She did not give an answer to that.<n><n>### Response<n>The output above is correct, but needs to read,"The woman did not give an answer."<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>1. The woman did not give an ___________ to that.<n><n>    * : true<n>    * : false<n>    * : that<n>    * : correct<n>    * : correct if that<n><n>2. She did not give an _______ to that.<n>    * : true answer<n>    * : answer to not that<n>    * : true to an<n><n>3. The woman did not _____ that.<n>    * ask an answer<n>    * : the answer to not that<n><n>### Input for 1:A: She said it did not.<n>B: She said it did.<n><n>### Output for 1:A:(false answer) (The woman did not give a false answer to that.)<n>B:(true answer) (The woman gave a true answer to that.)<n><n>### Response for 1:A.I can not tell because the woman did not give an true or false answer.<n>B.There was no answer. The woman did not answer the question.<n><n>## Description of solution:The woman will eventually tell us if she said a true or false, but we do not know right now, so the answer is No. She did not tell us if she is correct.<n><n>### Description of the instruction 1:Instead of asking if she is in her 40s or up, ask if she is in her "late 40s or over", I will explain this a little more in depth below.<n><n>### The woman will probably tell the truth when she has made a statement of fact.<n><n>### If the woman is lying, she will give the statement of the fact, but not with her words, she will say "I did not say that

Choices:  A: increased energy B: healthier C: loose skin D: beauty E: death<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A: increased energy<n><n>#### Solution<n><n>```python<n>if input == "healthier":<n>      answer = "Hooray! You're taking steps toward a healthier lifestyle."<n>else:<n>      answer = "Wrong! Try again."<n>print(answer)<n>```<n><n>#### Result<n>```python<n>Input: What is a good result of what?<n>[Choices:] A: loose skin B: increased energy<n>[Output:]<n>If this is "B", press "1".<n>Wrong! Try again.<n>```<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:What will happen to skin pinched in something? Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input:The machine was very intricate A: it was quite an wash dishes B: it was quite an box C: it was quite an implement D: it was quite an apparatus E: it was quite a appliance Output: The answer is Option C<n><n>### Demystification:<n><n>* If a request is answered with a task, it is a correct answer.<n>* If a request has no response, it indicates that it is an incorrect answer.<n>* Task responses can be written in plural or singular, e.g. If you wash dishes, that is a good, and this is an inappropriate.<n><n>#### How to write an Input task.<n><n>1.  A request consists of a subject, a subject complement and a verb. <n>2. Add a period at the end. <n>3. Begin your response with the subject. <n>4. Add your response to the end of the period.<n><n>e.g. The machine was very intricacies.<n>e.g. This is a very intricate machine.<n><n><n><n><n><n>------------------------A.1.4 Output:<n><n>Below is an instruction that describes an output. Write a response that accurately reproduces that output.<n><n>### Input1: What happens to skin pinched in a tight thing?<n><n>### Demostrator:<n><n>Input: What will happen to skin pinch in something? Output1: Choices:  A) feel cold B) feel pressure C) feel bumpy D) itches E) feel clammy <n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Input: If you wash dish, that is good. Answer: Option A: feel cold B) feel clammy C) itches D) feel pressure E) feel bumpy<n><n>### Insturctions:<n><n>Input1:What happens to skin pinch in a loose thing? Output2: Choices:  C) feel pressure D) itches E it feels clammy F) feel bumpy G) feel cold<n><n>### Demonytification:<n><n>* You cannot create an output request, but you can answer it correctly by adding a period at the end and answer it correctly.<n>* A request can be written in the singular or plural.<n><n><n>-------------------------------A.2 Input:<n>What is a

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Letters are sometimes delivered by hand through one of these. Choices:  A: mail box B: suitcase C: front door D: bowl E: post office<n><n>### Response:		<n>**I. Choices:  Choice A - A box**<n><n>It is a **box** where letters and other mail items are placed into it by mailers.<n><n><n>*Input:* Letters are sometimes delivered by **hand through a box** that is called:<n><n>**B. Choices:**  **Apparatus**<n><n>It is an **apparatus** which has something done with it.<n><n><n>Input (3) **Machine was very intricate(33** It is not really easy and complicated.<n><n><n>### Input (1):<n><n>Letters are sometimes delivered **by hand through one of these**.<n><n><n>*Output:* It is an object with something that one does something. It is an article or a part that something is used with and it is also a tool for doing something. It is also something that that something can do in someone.<n><n>### Choices:<n><n>*1. Choice A - A Box<n><n>2. Choice B - Apparatus<n><n>3. Choice C - Appliance<n><n>4. Choice D - Wash dishes<n><n>5. Choice E - Implement*<n><n>###<n><n><n>```javascript<n>const box = "box";<n><n>function makeQuestion(str){<n>  console.log(`Input: Letters are sometimes delivered **through one of these**.`)<n>  console.log(str);<n>}<n><n>makeQuestion(box)<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: cafeteria B: arranging papers C: in the park D: formal dining room E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you move a brand new dining table into the house, put it in a room that has no old furniture in it. You might put it in the formal dining room, but the room should be nice enough to match the quality. This room should also be a place where you or your family members can relax to eat, be it breakfast, lunch, or dinner.<n><n>### Input:"My home, my dining table, my everything." What is the main thought of this sentence?<n><n>Answer: D<n><n>## Input<n>"My family's favorite dish is chicken almondine." What is the main idea of the sentence? You should write:<n><n>* Place it in the oven<n>* Set the oven to 300 degrees<n>* Let the ham cook for 15 minutes per pound in a pan<n><n>### Demo <n><n>You should write: you take a ham, you make it into slices, you put it in the oven for two hours at 350 degrees.<n><n>## Demo:<n><n>1. Let it cook for five minutes per pound, then flip <n><n>2. Make a ham sandwich<n><n>3. Make egg salad with left over eggs<n><n>## Demo: <n>It's easy:<n><n>* Cut up the food<n>* Heat up the oven<n>* Stir the food with a spatula or whisk<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Answer: B: apparatus<n><n>### Input:Two friends wanted to spend a quiet evening together, what did they go see? Choices:  A: wedding B: friend's house C: internet cafe D: movie E: restaurant<n><n>### Response:		<n>Hello, I hope you've had a good week. This is what I've been busy with.<n><n>###  Input: What is it called when you're driving but still walking somewhere?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Answer: A: jaywalking<n><n><n>#### Multiple Choice:<n>What are the last three questions?<n><n>#### Response:<n><n>Hello, I hope your week has been good. I will answer your questions for you.<n>The first one is what you do when you go for a walk with someone. Second, what you say when you meet someone new. Third, what you write on a postcard to tell someone you are sorry. The fourth is what you say to someone when they stop by. Five, when someone calls your name for the first time at a party. Six is when someone comes to your place for the first time. Seven is when you say sorry to someone. Eight is what you say to the person you love. Nine, how to tell the person who has hurt you that you are not happy with it. Ten is what you say when you are happy to see someone you like after a long time.<n><n>###### Reference:<n>https://s2.studylib.net/file/12174369/English.pdf<n>
